question: If ABCD is a trapezoid, the length of the AD side is 8, the length of the AB side is 24, the length of the CD side is 16, BEFC is a rectangle, the length of the BE side is 11 and the diagonal of the BEFC rectangle is 24, compute the perimeter of the ABCD trapezoid. question: If ABC is a triangle, the length of the height perpendicular to the AC base in the ABC triangle is 12, the length of the height perpendicular to the AB base in the ABC triangle is 7, ADEC is a square and the area of the ADEC square is 81, compute the length of the AB side of the ABC triangle. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 56.52, we have a green semi-circle with BC being the diameter and the area of the green semi-circle is 100.48, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a triangle, the degree of the BCA angle is 50, the degree of the BAD angle is 45 and the adjacent angles BAC and BAD are complementary, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a triangle, the length of the AB side is 18, the length of the BC side is 9, ADEC is a rectangle, the length of the AD side is 12 and the diagonal of the ADEC rectangle is 25, compute the area of the ABC triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 12, AEFB is a rectangle, the length of the AE side is 23 and the perimeter of the AEFB rectangle is 70, compute the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 7, the area of the ABCD parallelogram is 102, AEFB is a parallelogram, the length of the AE side is 9, the degree of the BAE angle is 30 and the area of the AEFB parallelogram is 96, compute the degree of the BAD angle. question: If ABC is a right triangle with ACB being the right angle, the length of the BC side is 20, ACD is a triangle, the length of the AD side is 13, the length of the height perpendicular to the AD base in the ACD triangle is 7 and the length of the height perpendicular to the AC base in the ACD triangle is 12, compute the length of the AB side of the ABC right triangle. question: If ABC is a right triangle with ACB being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 16, ADEC is a rectangle, the length of the AD side is 9 and the diagonal of the ADEC rectangle is 14, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram is 50, ABE is a triangle, the length of the AE side is 16, the length of the BE side is 11 and the perimeter of the ABE triangle is 45, compute the length of the AD side of the ABCD parallelogram. question: If ABC is a triangle, the degree of the CAB angle is 30, the degree of the DCB angle is 45 and the adjacent angles BCA and DCB are complementary, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 16, AEFB is a square and the diagonal of the AEFB square is 29, compute the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the arc length of the ABC sector is 17.99, DBE is a sector with the arc being from D to E, the length of the BD side is 20, the arc length of the DBE sector is 20.56 and the angle CBA is vertical to DBE, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the arc length of the ABC sector is 15.42, DBC is a sector with the arc being from D to C, the degree of the CBD angle is 75 and the arc length of the DBC sector is 23.13, compute the degree of the CBA angle. question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram is 52, ABE is a triangle, the length of the AE side is 23, the degree of the BAE angle is 55 and the degree of the BEA angle is 35, compute the length of the AD side of the ABCD parallelogram. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 76.93, BDE is a right triangle with EDB being the right angle, the length of the DE side is 16, the length of the BE side is 21 and the angle DBE is vertical to CBA, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. question: If ABC is a triangle, the length of the AC side is 22, the length of the AB side is 15, BCD is a triangle, the length of the BD side is 24, the length of the height perpendicular to the BD base in the BCD triangle is 20 and the length of the height perpendicular to the BC base in the BCD triangle is 21, compute the area of the ABC triangle. question: If ABC is a right triangle with CAB being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 15, ACD is a right triangle with DAC being the right angle, the length of the AD side is 18 and the area of the ACD right triangle is 55, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC right triangle. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the degree of the CBA angle is 55, BCD is a triangle, the length of the height perpendicular to the BC base in the BCD triangle is 19 and the area of the BCD triangle is 49, compute the arc length of the ABC sector. question: If ABC is a triangle, the degree of the CBA angle is 30, ADEF is a parallelogram, the length of the AF side is 13, the length of the AD side is 21, the area of the ADEF parallelogram is 72 and the angle FAD is vertical to BAC, compute the degree of the BCA angle. question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 19, EAB is a sector with the arc being from E to B, the degree of the BAE angle is 60 and the arc length of the EAB sector is 15.42, compute the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram. question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 11, the degree of the BAD angle is 30, ABE is a right triangle with EAB being the right angle, the length of the AE side is 8 and the length of the BE side is 16, compute the area of the ABCD parallelogram. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 157, the degree of the CBD angle is 35 and the adjacent angles CBA and CBD are complementary, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the arc length of the ABC sector is 15.42, BCD is a right triangle with DBC being the right angle, the length of the BD side is 8 and the area of the BCD right triangle is 22, compute the degree of the CBA angle. question: If ABC is a right triangle with CAB being the right angle, the area of the ABC right triangle is 115, ADEC is a square and the perimeter of the ADEC square is 80, compute the length of the AB side of the ABC right triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with BAC being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 9, ADEC is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 16, the degree of the CAD angle is 30 and the area of the ADEC parallelogram is 108, compute the area of the ABC right triangle. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 127.17, the degree of the CBD angle is 45 and the adjacent angles CBA and CBD are complementary, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a triangle, the degree of the BCA angle is 60, ADE is a right triangle with EDA being the right angle, the length of the DE side is 10, the length of the AE side is 15 and the angle BAC is vertical to EAD, compute the degree of the CBA angle. question: If ABC is a triangle, the length of the BC side is 8, the length of the AB side is 17, ADEC is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 10, the degree of the CAD angle is 65 and the area of the ADEC parallelogram is 120, compute the perimeter of the ABC triangle. question: If ABC is a right triangle with CAB being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 6, ACD is a right triangle with DAC being the right angle, the length of the AD side is 20 and the length of the CD side is 23, compute the perimeter of the ABC right triangle. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 127.17, BCD is a right triangle with DBC being the right angle, the length of the BD side is 9 and the length of the CD side is 17, compute the degree of the CBA angle. question: If ABCD is a rectangle, the length of the AD side is 21, ABE is a triangle, the length of the AE side is 21, the length of the height perpendicular to the AE base in the ABE triangle is 10 and the length of the height perpendicular to the AB base in the ABE triangle is 20, compute the area of the ABCD rectangle. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 100.48, BDE is a triangle, the degree of the BDE angle is 55, the degree of the BED angle is 70 and the angle CBA is vertical to EBD, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. cot: The degrees of the BDE and the BED angles of the BDE triangle are 55 and 70, so the degree of the EBD angle $= 180 - 55 - 70 = 55$. The angle CBA is vertical to the angle EBD so the degree of the CBA angle = 55. The CBA angle of the ABC sector is 55 and the area is 100.48 so the BC radius can be computed as $\sqrt{\frac{100.48}{\frac{55}{360} * \pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{100.48}{0.15 * \pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{100.48}{0.47}} = \sqrt{213.79} = 14.62$. Therefore the final answer is 14.62.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with CAB being the right angle, the area of the ABC right triangle is 108, ACD is a triangle, the length of the AD side is 6, the length of the CD side is 11 and the degree of the ADC angle is 70, compute the length of the AB side of the ABC right triangle. cot: For the ACD triangle, the lengths of the AD and CD sides are 6 and 11 and the degree of the angle between them is 70. Therefore, the length of the AC side is equal to $\sqrt{6^2 + 11^2 - (2 * 6 * 11) * \cos(70)} = \sqrt{36 + 121 - 132 * (0.34)} = \sqrt{157 - (44.88)} = \sqrt{112.12} = 10.59$. The length of the AC side in the ABC triangle is 10.59 and the area is 108 so the length of the AB side $= \frac{108 * 2}{10.59} = \frac{216}{10.59} = 20.4$. Therefore the final answer is 20.4.

question: If ABCD is a trapezoid, the length of the AD side is 23, the length of the height of the ABCD trapezoid is 7, BEFC is a rectangle, the length of the BE side is 15 and the area of the BEFC rectangle is 114, compute the area of the ABCD trapezoid. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

Therefore the final answer is 107.1.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 189.97, DBE is a sector with the arc being from D to E, the length of the BD side is 14, the area of the DBE sector is 157 and the angle DBE is vertical to CBA, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 189.97, the degree of the CBD angle is 55 and the adjacent angles CBA and CBD are complementary, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 127.17, BCD is a triangle, the length of the BD side is 21, the degree of the CBD angle is 65 and the degree of the CDB angle is 45, compute the degree of the CBA angle. question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 10, the area of the ABCD parallelogram is 60, we have a cyan semi-circle with AB being the diameter and the circumference of the cyan semi-circle is 51.4, compute the degree of the BAD angle. question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram is 92, EAB is a sector with the arc being from E to B, the degree of the BAE angle is 55 and the arc length of the EAB sector is 20.56, compute the length of the AD side of the ABCD parallelogram. question: If ABCD is a rectangle, the length of the AD side is 11, AEFB is a square and the area of the AEFB square is 49, compute the diagonal of the ABCD rectangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the degree of the CBA angle is 35, BCD is a triangle, the length of the BD side is 23, the length of the height perpendicular to the BD base in the BCD triangle is 6 and the length of the height perpendicular to the BC base in the BCD triangle is 8, compute the arc length of the ABC sector. question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 19, the degree of the DAB angle is 55, EAB is a sector with the arc being from E to B, the degree of the BAE angle is 70 and the arc length of the EAB sector is 17.99, compute the area of the ABCD parallelogram. question: If ABC is a triangle, the degree of the BCA angle is 40, ADEF is a parallelogram, the length of the AF side is 10, the length of the AD side is 14, the area of the ADEF parallelogram is 72 and the angle FAD is vertical to CAB, compute the degree of the CBA angle. question: If ABC is a right triangle with BAC being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 19, ACD is a right triangle with DAC being the right angle, the length of the AD side is 14 and the area of the ACD right triangle is 48, compute the area of the ABC right triangle. question: If ABCD is a rectangle, the perimeter of the ABCD rectangle is 68, ABE is a triangle, the length of the AE side is 24, the degree of the BAE angle is 30 and the degree of the AEB angle is 45, compute the length of the AD side of the ABCD rectangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABCD is a trapezoid, the length of the AB side is 22, the length of the BC side is 8, the length of the AD side is 13, EDC is a sector with the arc being from E to C, the degree of the EDC angle is 55 and the area of the EDC sector is 39.25, compute the perimeter of the ABCD trapezoid. question: If ABC is a right triangle with CAB being the right angle, the degree of the CBA angle is 45, ADEC is a square and the area of the ADEC square is 36, compute the length of the AB side of the ABC right triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the arc length of the ABC sector is 20.56, DBE is a sector with the arc being from D to E, the length of the BD side is 9, the arc length of the DBE sector is 20.56 and the angle DBE is vertical to CBA, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. question: If ABC is a triangle, the length of the AB side is 24, the length of the BC side is 16, DAC is a sector with the arc being from D to C, the degree of the CAD angle is 50 and the area of the DAC sector is 100.48, compute the perimeter of the ABC triangle. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the length of the BC side is 15, BDEF is a parallelogram, the length of the BF side is 20, the length of the BD side is 6, the area of the BDEF parallelogram is 96 and the angle DBF is vertical to CBA, compute the area of the ABC sector. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The lengths of the BF and the BD sides of the BDEF parallelogram are 20 and 6 and the area is 96 so the sine of the DBF angle is $\frac{96}{20 * 6} = 0.8$ and so the angle in degrees is $\arcsin(0.8) = 53.13$. The angle CBA is vertical to the angle DBF so the degree of the CBA angle = 53.13. The BC radius and the CBA angle of the ABC sector are 15 and 53.13 respectively. So the area of ABC sector can be computed as $\frac{53.13}{360} * (\pi * 15^2) = 0.15 * 706.5 = 105.97$. Therefore the final answer is 105.97.

question: If ABCD is a rectangle, the diagonal of the ABCD rectangle is 18, AEFB is a square and the diagonal of the AEFB square is 12, compute the length of the AD side of the ABCD rectangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The diagonal of the AEFB square is 12, so the length of the AB side is $\frac{12}{\sqrt{2}} = \frac{12}{1.41} = 8.51$. The diagonal of the ABCD rectangle is 18 and the length of its AB side is 8.51, so the length of the AD side is $\sqrt{18^2 - 8.51^2} = \sqrt{324 - 72.42} = \sqrt{251.58} = 15.86$. Therefore the final answer is 15.86.

question: If ABC is a triangle, the degree of the BAC angle is 70, the degree of the BCD angle is 50 and the adjacent angles BCA and BCD are complementary, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The sum of the degrees of an angle and its complementary angle is 90. The BCA angle has a complementary angle with degree 50 so the degree of the BCA angle is 90 - 50 = 40. The degrees of the BAC and the BCA angles of the ABC triangle are 70 and 40, so the degree of the CBA angle $= 180 - 70 - 40 = 70$. Therefore the final answer is 70.

question: If ABCD is a rectangle, the length of the AD side is 24, AEFB is a square and the diagonal of the AEFB square is 10, compute the diagonal of the ABCD rectangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The diagonal of the AEFB square is 10, so the length of the AB side is $\frac{10}{\sqrt{2}} = \frac{10}{1.41} = 7.09$. The lengths of the AB and the AD sides of the ABCD rectangle are $7.09$ and $24$, so the length of the diagonal is $\sqrt{7.09^2 + 24^2} = \sqrt{50.27 + 576} = \sqrt{626.27} = 25.03$. Therefore the final answer is 25.03.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with BAC being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 18, the degree of the BCD angle is 40 and the adjacent angles BCA and BCD are complementary, compute the length of the AC side of the ABC right triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The sum of the degrees of an angle and its complementary angle is 90. The BCA angle has a complementary angle with degree 40 so the degree of the BCA angle is 90 - 40 = 50. The length of the AB side in the ABC triangle is $18$ and its opposite angle has a degree of $50$ so the length of the AC side equals $\frac{18}{tan(50)} = \frac{18}{1.19} = 15.13$. Therefore the final answer is 15.13.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 10, the area of the ABCD parallelogram is 102, AEFB is a square and the diagonal of the AEFB square is 31, compute the degree of the BAD angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The diagonal of the AEFB square is 31, so the length of the AB side is $\frac{31}{\sqrt{2}} = \frac{31}{1.41} = 21.99$. The lengths of the AD and the AB sides of the ABCD parallelogram are 10 and 21.99 and the area is 102 so the sine of the BAD angle is $\frac{102}{10 * 21.99} = 0.46$ and so the angle in degrees is $\arcsin(0.46) = 27.39$. Therefore the final answer is 27.39.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with CAB being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 8, ADEC is a square and the area of the ADEC square is 64, compute the area of the ABC right triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The area of the ADEC square is 64, so the length of the AC side is $\sqrt{64} = 8$. The lengths of the AC and AB sides of the ABC triangle are 8 and 8, so the area of the triangle is $\frac{8 * 8}{2} = \frac{64}{2} = 32$. Therefore the final answer is 32.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 11, the area of the ABCD parallelogram is 66, AEFB is a square and the diagonal of the AEFB square is 17, compute the degree of the DAB angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The diagonal of the AEFB square is 17, so the length of the AB side is $\frac{17}{\sqrt{2}} = \frac{17}{1.41} = 12.06$. The lengths of the AB and the AD sides of the ABCD parallelogram are 12.06 and 11 and the area is 66 so the sine of the DAB angle is $\frac{66}{12.06 * 11} = 0.5$ and so the angle in degrees is $\arcsin(0.5) = 30.0$. Therefore the final answer is 30.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with CAB being the right angle, the length of the AC side is 6, BDEC is a square and the perimeter of the BDEC square is 44, compute the length of the AB side of the ABC right triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The perimeter of the BDEC square is 44, so the length of the BC side is $\frac{44}{4} = 11$. The length of the hypotenuse of the ABC triangle is 11 and the length of the AC side is 6, so the length of the AB side is $\sqrt{11^2 - 6^2} = \sqrt{121 - 36} = \sqrt{85} = 9.22$. Therefore the final answer is 9.22.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 10, ABE is a triangle, the length of the height perpendicular to the AB base in the ABE triangle is 30 and the area of the ABE triangle is 121, compute the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: For the ABE triangle, the length of the height perpendicular to the AB base is 30 and the area is 121 so the length of the AB base is $\frac{2 * 121}{30} = \frac{242}{30} = 8.07$. The lengths of the AD and the AB sides of the ABCD parallelogram are 10 and 8.07, so the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram is $2 * (10 + 8.07) = 2 * 18.07 = 36.14$. Therefore the final answer is 36.14.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 19, we have a brown semi-circle with AB being the diameter and the circumference of the brown semi-circle is 51.4, compute the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The circumference of the brown semi-circle is 51.4 so the AB diameter can be computed as $\frac{51.4}{1 + \frac{3.14}{2}} = \frac{51.4}{2.57} = 20$. The lengths of the AD and the AB sides of the ABCD parallelogram are 19 and 20, so the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram is $2 * (19 + 20) = 2 * 39 = 78$. Therefore the final answer is 78.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with BAC being the right angle, the degree of the BCA angle is 35, DBC is a sector with the arc being from D to C, the degree of the DBC angle is 55 and the arc length of the DBC sector is 20.56, compute the length of the AB side of the ABC right triangle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The DBC angle of the DBC sector is 55 and the arc length is 20.56 so the BC radius can be computed as $\frac{20.56}{\frac{55}{360} * (2 * \pi)} = \frac{20.56}{0.15 * (2 * \pi)} = \frac{20.56}{0.94}= 21.87$. The length of the hypotenuse of the ABC triangle is 21.87 and the degree of the angle opposite to the AB side is 35, so the length of the AB side is equal to $21.87 * \sin(35) = 21.87 * 0.57 = 12.47$. Therefore the final answer is 12.47.

question: If ABC is a triangle, the length of the AC side is 11, the length of the AB side is 9, BCD is a right triangle with DBC being the right angle, the length of the BD side is 21 and the length of the CD side is 24, compute the area of the ABC triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The length of the hypotenuse of the BCD triangle is 24 and the length of the BD side is 21, so the length of the BC side is $\sqrt{24^2 - 21^2} = \sqrt{576 - 441} = \sqrt{135} = 11.62$. We know the lengths of the AC, BC and AB sides of the ABC triangle are 11 and 11.62 and 9, so the semi-perimeter equals $(11 + 11.62 + 9) / 2 = 15.81$. So the area is $\sqrt{15.81 * (15.81-11) * (15.81-11.62) * (15.81-9)} = \sqrt{15.81 * 4.81 * 4.19 * 6.81} = \sqrt{2169.89} = 46.58$. Therefore the final answer is 46.58.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 15, the area of the ABCD parallelogram is 96, EAB is a sector with the arc being from E to B, the degree of the BAE angle is 65 and the area of the EAB sector is 157, compute the degree of the BAD angle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The BAE angle of the EAB sector is 65 and the area is 157 so the AB radius can be computed as $\sqrt{\frac{157}{\frac{65}{360} * \pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{157}{0.18 * \pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{157}{0.57}} = \sqrt{275.44} = 16.6$. The lengths of the AB and the AD sides of the ABCD parallelogram are 16.6 and 15 and the area is 96 so the sine of the BAD angle is $\frac{96}{16.6 * 15} = 0.39$ and so the angle in degrees is $\arcsin(0.39) = 22.95$. Therefore the final answer is 22.95.

question: If ABC is a triangle, the degree of the BAC angle is 65, the degree of the BCD angle is 50 and the adjacent angles BCA and BCD are complementary, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The sum of the degrees of an angle and its complementary angle is 90. The BCA angle has a complementary angle with degree 50 so the degree of the BCA angle is 90 - 50 = 40. The degrees of the BCA and the BAC angles of the ABC triangle are 40 and 65, so the degree of the CBA angle $= 180 - 40 - 65 = 75$. Therefore the final answer is 75.

question: If ABCD is a square, AEFD is a square and the perimeter of the AEFD square is 88, compute the area of the ABCD square. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The perimeter of the AEFD square is 88, so the length of the AD side is $\frac{88}{4} = 22$. The length of the AD side of the ABCD square is 22, so its area is $22 * 22 = 484$. Therefore the final answer is 484.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the length of the BC side is 8, the degree of the CBD angle is 65 and the adjacent angles CBA and CBD are complementary, compute the area of the ABC sector. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

The BC radius and the CBA angle of the ABC sector are 8 and 25 respectively. So the area of ABC sector can be computed as $\frac{25}{360} * (\pi * 8^2) = 0.07 * 200.96 = 14.07$. Therefore the final answer is 14.07.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with BAC being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 8, BCD is a right triangle with DBC being the right angle, the length of the BD side is 18 and the length of the CD side is 22, compute the degree of the BCA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The length of the hypotenuse of the BCD triangle is 22 and the length of the BD side is 18, so the length of the BC side is $\sqrt{22^2 - 18^2} = \sqrt{484 - 324} = \sqrt{160} = 12.65$. The length of the hypotenuse of the ABC triangle is 12.65 and the length of the side opposite to the BCA angle is 8, so the BCA angle equals $\arcsin(\frac{8}{12.65}) = \arcsin(0.63) = 39.05$. Therefore the final answer is 39.05.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with ACB being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 24, ACD is a triangle, the length of the height perpendicular to the AC base in the ACD triangle is 15 and the area of the ACD triangle is 121, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: For the ACD triangle, the length of the height perpendicular to the AC base is 15 and the area is 121 so the length of the AC base is $\frac{2 * 121}{15} = \frac{242}{15} = 16.13$. The length of the hypotenuse of the ABC triangle is 24 and the length of the side opposite to the CBA angle is 16.13, so the CBA angle equals $\arcsin(\frac{16.13}{24}) = \arcsin(0.67) = 42.07$. Therefore the final answer is 42.07.

question: If ABCD is a rectangle, the length of the AD side is 21, we have a brown semi-circle with AB being the diameter and the area of the brown semi-circle is 189.97, compute the perimeter of the ABCD rectangle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The area of the brown semi-circle is 189.97 so the length of the AB diameter can be computed as $\sqrt{\frac{8 * 189.97}{\pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{1519.76}{3.14}} = \sqrt{484.0} = 22$. The lengths of the AD and the AB sides of the ABCD rectangle are 21 and 22, so the perimeter of the ABCD rectangle is $2 * (21 + 22) = 2 * 43 = 86$. Therefore the final answer is 86.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the arc length of the ABC sector is 12.85, BDEC is a square and the area of the BDEC square is 100, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The area of the BDEC square is 100, so the length of the BC side is $\sqrt{100} = 10$. The BC radius of the ABC sector is 10 and the arc length is 12.85. So the CBA angle can be computed as $\frac{ArcLength}{2 \pi r} * 360 = \frac{12.85}{2 \pi * 10} * 360 = \frac{12.85}{62.8} * 360 = 0.2 * 360 = 72$. Therefore the final answer is 72.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with ACB being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 18, ADEC is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 17, the degree of the CAD angle is 50 and the area of the ADEC parallelogram is 72, compute the degree of the CBA angle. cot: The length of the AD side of the ADEC parallelogram is 17, the area is 72 and the CAD angle is 50. The length of the hypotenuse of the ABC triangle is 18 and the length of the side opposite to the CBA angle is 5.5, so the CBA angle equals $\arcsin(\frac{5.5}{18}) = \arcsin(0.31) = 18.06$. Therefore the final answer is 18.06.

question: If ABC is a triangle, the degree of the BCA angle is 45, ADEF is a parallelogram, the length of the AF side is 8, the length of the AD side is 18, the area of the ADEF parallelogram is 90 and the angle FAD is vertical to CAB, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The lengths of the AF and the AD sides of the ADEF parallelogram are 8 and 18 and the area is 90 so the sine of the FAD angle is $\frac{90}{8 * 18} = 0.62$ and so the angle in degrees is $\arcsin(0.62) = 38.32$. The angle CAB is vertical to the angle FAD so the degree of the CAB angle = 38.32. The degrees of the CAB and the BCA angles of the ABC triangle are 38.32 and 45, so the degree of the CBA angle $= 180 - 38.32 - 45 = 96.68$. Therefore the final answer is 96.68.

question: If ABCD is a rectangle, the length of the AD side is 24, we have a blue semi-circle with AB being the diameter and the area of the blue semi-circle is 76.93, compute the perimeter of the ABCD rectangle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

The lengths of the AD and the AB sides of the ABCD rectangle are 24 and 14, so the perimeter of the ABCD rectangle is $2 * (24 + 14) = 2 * 38 = 76$. Therefore the final answer is 76.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AB side is 22, the area of the ABCD parallelogram is 48, AEFG is a parallelogram, the length of the AG side is 21, the length of the AE side is 12, the area of the AEFG parallelogram is 108 and the angle EAG is vertical to BAD, compute the length of the AD side of the ABCD parallelogram. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The lengths of the AG and the AE sides of the AEFG parallelogram are 21 and 12 and the area is 108 so the sine of the EAG angle is $\frac{108}{21 * 12} = 0.43$ and so the angle in degrees is $\arcsin(0.43) = 25.47$. The angle BAD is vertical to the angle EAG so the degree of the BAD angle = 25.47. The length of the AB side of the ABCD parallelogram is 22, the area is 48 and the BAD angle is 25.47. So, the sine of the angle is $\sin(25.47) = 0.43$, so the length of the AD side is $\frac{48}{22 * 0.43} = \frac{48}{9.46} = 5.07$. Therefore the final answer is 5.07.

question: If ABC is a triangle, the degree of the BAC angle is 40, the degree of the BCD angle is 20 and the adjacent angles BCA and BCD are complementary, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABCD is a square, AEFD is a rectangle, the length of the AE side is 19 and the perimeter of the AEFD rectangle is 58, compute the perimeter of the ABCD square. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The perimeter of the AEFD rectangle is 58 and the length of its AE side is 19, so the length of the AD side is $\frac{58}{2} - 19 = 29.0 - 19 = 10$. The length of the AD side of the ABCD square is 10, so its perimeter is $4 * 10 = 40$. Therefore the final answer is 40.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the degree of the DAB angle is 20, the area of the ABCD parallelogram is 120, AEFB is a square and the perimeter of the AEFB square is 72, compute the length of the AD side of the ABCD parallelogram. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 189.97, BDEC is a rectangle, the length of the BD side is 20 and the diagonal of the BDEC rectangle is 25, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The diagonal of the BDEC rectangle is 25 and the length of its BD side is 20, so the length of the BC side is $\sqrt{25^2 - 20^2} = \sqrt{625 - 400} = \sqrt{225} = 15$. The BC radius of the ABC sector is 15 and the area is 189.97. So the CBA angle can be computed as $\frac{area}{\pi * r^2} * 360 = \frac{189.97}{\pi * 15^2} * 360 = \frac{189.97}{706.5} * 360 = 0.27 * 360 = 97.2$. Therefore the final answer is 97.2.

question: If ABC is a triangle, the length of the AB side is 19, the perimeter of the ABC triangle is 50, BCD is a right triangle with DBC being the right angle, the length of the BD side is 7 and the degree of the DCB angle is 45, compute the length of the AC side of the ABC triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The length of the BD side in the BCD triangle is $7$ and its opposite angle has a degree of $45$ so the length of the BC side equals $\frac{7}{tan(45)} = \frac{7}{1.0} = 7$. The lengths of the AB and BC sides of the ABC triangle are 19 and 7 and the perimeter is 50, so the lengths of the AC side equals $50 - 19 - 7 = 24$. Therefore the final answer is 24.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the degree of the CBA angle is 75, DBC is a sector with the arc being from D to C, the degree of the CBD angle is 60 and the area of the DBC sector is 189.97, compute the arc length of the ABC sector. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

Therefore the final answer is 24.96.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with BAC being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 15, the degree of the BCD angle is 35 and the adjacent angles BCA and BCD are complementary, compute the length of the AC side of the ABC right triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the arc length of the ABC sector is 20.56, DBC is a sector with the arc being from D to C, the degree of the CBD angle is 30 and the area of the DBC sector is 76.93, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: The CBD angle of the DBC sector is 30 and the area is 76.93 so the BC radius can be computed as $\sqrt{\frac{76.93}{\frac{30}{360} * \pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{76.93}{0.08 * \pi}} = \sqrt{\frac{76.93}{0.25}} = \sqrt{307.72} = 17.54$. The BC radius of the ABC sector is 17.54 and the arc length is 20.56. question: If ABC is a triangle, the length of the AB side is 20, the length of the BC side is 20, ACD is a triangle, the length of the AD side is 10, the length of the CD side is 12 and the degree of the CDA angle is 50, compute the area of the ABC triangle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
cot: For the ACD triangle, the lengths of the AD and CD sides are 10 and 12 and the degree of the angle between them is 50. Therefore, the length of the AC side is equal to $\sqrt{10^2 + 12^2 - (2 * 10 * 12) * \cos(50)} = \sqrt{100 + 144 - 240 * (0.64)} = \sqrt{244 - (153.6)} = \sqrt{90.4} = 9.51$. We know the lengths of the AB, AC and BC sides of the ABC triangle are 20 and 9.51 and 20, so the semi-perimeter equals $(20 + 9.51 + 20) / 2 = 24.75$. So the area is $\sqrt{24.75 * (24.75-20) * (24.75-9.51) * (24.75-20)} = \sqrt{24.75 * 4.75 * 15.24 * 4.75} = \sqrt{8510.35} = 92.25$. Therefore the final answer is 92.25.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 22, the area of the ABCD parallelogram is 78, AEFB is a parallelogram, the length of the AE side is 11, the degree of the BAE angle is 25 and the area of the AEFB parallelogram is 36, compute the degree of the DAB angle. Therefore the final answer is 27.39.

question: If ABC is a right triangle with ACB being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 17, ADEC is a square and the perimeter of the ADEC square is 36, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the degree of the DAB angle is 65, the area of the ABCD parallelogram is 72, EAB is a sector with the arc being from E to B, the degree of the BAE angle is 50 and the area of the EAB sector is 39.25, compute the length of the AD side of the ABCD parallelogram. question: If ABCD is a trapezoid, the length of the BC side is 23, the length of the AD side is 8, the length of the CD side is 17, AEFB is a square and the area of the AEFB square is 81, compute the perimeter of the ABCD trapezoid. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

Therefore the final answer is 57.

question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the length of the AD side is 11, the area of the ABCD parallelogram is 114, EAB is a sector with the arc being from E to B, the degree of the BAE angle is 50 and the arc length of the EAB sector is 20.56, compute the degree of the BAD angle. The lengths of the AB and the AD sides of the ABCD parallelogram are 23.36 and 11 and the area is 114 so the sine of the BAD angle is $\frac{114}{23.36 * 11} = 0.44$ and so the angle in degrees is $\arcsin(0.44) = 26.1$. question: If ABC is a right triangle with BAC being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 21, ACD is a triangle, the length of the AD side is 18, the degree of the CAD angle is 20 and the degree of the CDA angle is 30, compute the area of the ABC right triangle. cot: The degrees of the CAD and the CDA angles of the ACD triangle are 20 and 30, so the degree of the ACD angle $= 180 - 20 - 30 = 130$. For the ACD triangle the length of the AD side is 18 and its opposite angle is 130 so the ratio is $\frac{18}{sin(130)} = \frac{18}{0.77} = 23.38$. The lengths of the AB and AC sides of the ABC triangle are 21 and 11.69, so the area of the triangle is $\frac{21 * 11.69}{2} = \frac{245.49}{2} = 122.75$. Therefore the final answer is 122.75.

question: If ABC is a triangle, the length of the AC side is 11, the length of the AB side is 24, DAE is a sector with the arc being from D to E, the length of the AD side is 15, the arc length of the DAE sector is 20.56 and the angle DAE is vertical to BAC, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC triangle. question: If ABCD is a rectangle, the length of the AD side is 9, EAB is a sector with the arc being from E to B, the degree of the BAE angle is 70 and the arc length of the EAB sector is 12.85, compute the area of the ABCD rectangle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.

question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 189.97, DBC is a sector with the arc being from D to C, the degree of the CBD angle is 75 and the arc length of the DBC sector is 20.56, compute the degree of the CBA angle. question: If ABC is a sector with the arc being from A to C, the area of the ABC sector is 56.52, DBE is a sector with the arc being from D to E, the length of the BD side is 13, the area of the DBE sector is 157 and the angle CBA is vertical to DBE, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. question: If ABC is a right triangle with BAC being the right angle, the length of the AB side is 7, BCD is a right triangle with DBC being the right angle, the length of the BD side is 10 and the length of the CD side is 21, compute the degree of the BCA angle. question: If ABCD is a parallelogram, the perimeter of the ABCD parallelogram is 60, ABE is a triangle, the length of the AE side is 15, the length of the height perpendicular to the AE base in the ABE triangle is 17 and the length of the height perpendicular to the AB base in the ABE triangle is 11, compute the length of the AD side of the ABCD parallelogram.
